metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter expressing regret that Sung Sing left Andover. Stearns states that he was prepared for this decision when Sung Sing's father called his son back to China. Stearns considers Sung Sing an Andover man in spirit and knows that he has many friends. Stearns is appreciative of Sung Sing's letters and will continue to be interested in hearing from him. He closes with comments about new dormitories and other projects; he notes that Lee and Lun Cho Sun spent the summer at Stearns' brothers camp and that Tommie Lee was also at the Lake and a fine man in the woods. A final bill will be sent soon.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
